title: The Swinging Blue Jeans - Hippy Hippy Shake, The Definitive Coll
description:
This is the same torrent that was uploaded to Demonoid in September 2011.


The Swinging Blue Jeans - Hippy Hippy Shake: The Definitive Collection (1993)
 <a href="
http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/519DX5582SL._SL500_AA300_.jpg" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/519DX5582SL._SL500_AA300_.jpg</a>

Includes:
Files by track, ripped at FLAC 8 using Easy CD-DA Extractor (www.poikosoft.com) DVD-ROM: LG GDR816B
Tracks have full tags (including embedded thumbnail)
AMG Bio.txt
AMG Review.txt
info.txt (which is simply these notes included in the torrent)

First biography paragraph from All Music (by Richie Unterberger & Bruce Eder):

Although they're only remembered today for their 1964 hit "Hippy Hippy Shake," which charted on both sides of the Atlantic -- the Swinging Blue Jeans were actually one of the strongest of the Liverpool bands from the '60s British Invasion; and, indeed, the Blue Jeans' earliest incarnation goes back about as far as the roots of the Beatles as the Quarry Men. "Hippy Hippy Shake" -- a cover of an obscure '50s rocker that was actually done much better by the Beatles on tapes of their BBC performances -- was their only Top 30 entry in the U.S.. But the band enjoyed some other major and minor hits in the U.K., including a top-notch Merseyization of Betty Everett's (and later Linda Ronstadt's) "You're No Good," which they took into the British Top Five in 1964.

Read all of the bio at: <a href="
http://www.allmusic.com/artist/the-swinging-blue-jeans-p20889/biography" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://www.allmusic.com/artist/the-swinging-blue-jeans-p20889/biography</a>

All Music Album Review (by Richie Unterberger):

All of their U.K. and U.S. hits are included on this compilation. Highlights are "You're No Good," "Hippy Hippy Shake," and their fine (pre-Who) cover of Johnny Kidd's "Shakin' All Over," though even for the Anglophile, about half of this CD is forgettable, especially the dreary post-1966 stuff. This anthology includes several non-LP/rare singles and unreleased songs.

Taken from: <a href="
http://www.allmusic.com/album/hippy-hippy-shake-the-definitive-collection-r170352" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://www.allmusic.com/album/hippy-hippy-shake-the-definitive-collection-r170352</a>
